Instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine ground beef, breadcrumbs, milk, beaten egg, finely chopped onion, minced garlic cloves, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, dried thyme, salt, and black pepper.
Mix the ingredients together until well combined. Be careful not to overmix.
Transfer the meat mixture to a greased loaf pan, shaping it into a loaf shape.
Spread a thin layer of ketchup over the top of the meatloaf for added flavor and moisture, if desired.
Bake the meatloaf in the preheated oven for 1 hour, or until it is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 160°F.
Once done, remove the meatloaf from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing.
Slice the meatloaf into thick slices and serve hot.
Enjoy your classic and comforting meatloaf!
